alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 15 at 2:46PM PDT until September 15 at 3:30PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE WILDCAT FIRE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTH CENTRAL ELKO COUNTY... At 246 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Wildcat Fire Burn Scar. Between 0.4 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.1 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Wildcat Fire Burn Scar. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Wildcat Fire Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Wildcat Fire Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... The Wildcat Fire Burn Scar of North Central Elko County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.1 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
